definitions.text: the season when the leaves fall from the trees
examples: in the fall of 1973

definitions.text: a sudden drop from an upright position
examples: he had a nasty spill on the ice

definitions.text: the lapse of mankind into sinfulness because of the sin of Adam and Eve
examples: women have been blamed ever since the Fall

definitions.text: a downward slope or bend
a lapse into sin; a loss of innocence or of chastity
examples: a fall from virtue

definitions.text: a sudden decline in strength or number or importance
examples: the fall of the House of Hapsburg

definitions.text: a movement downward
examples: the rise and fall of the tides

definitions.text: the act of surrendering (usually under agreed conditions)
examples: they were protected until the capitulation of the fort

definitions.text: the time of day immediately following sunset
examples: he loved the twilight
they finished before the fall of night

definitions.text: when a wrestler's shoulders are forced to the mat
a free and rapid descent by the force of gravity
examples: it was a miracle that he survived the drop from that height

definitions.text: a sudden sharp decrease in some quantity
examples: a drop of 57 points on the Dow Jones index
there was a drop in pressure in the pulmonary artery
a dip in prices
when that became known the price of their stock went into free fall

definitions.text: descend in free fall under the influence of gravity
examples: The branch fell from the tree
The unfortunate hiker fell into a crevasse

definitions.text: move downward and lower, but not necessarily all the way
examples: The temperature is going down
The barometer is falling
The curtain fell on the diva
Her hand went up and then fell again

definitions.text: pass suddenly and passively into a state of body or mind
examples: fall into a trap
She fell ill
They fell out of favor
Fall in love
fall asleep
fall prey to an imposter
fall into a strange way of thinking
she fell to pieces after she lost her work

definitions.text: come under, be classified or included
examples: fall into a category
This comes under a new heading

definitions.text: fall from clouds
examples: rain, snow and sleet were falling
Vesuvius precipitated its fiery, destructive rage on Herculaneum

definitions.text: suffer defeat, failure, or ruin
examples: We must stand or fall
fall by the wayside

definitions.text: die, as in battle or in a hunt
examples: Many soldiers fell at Verdun
Several deer have fallen to the same gun
The shooting victim fell dead

definitions.text: touch or seem as if touching visually or audibly
examples: Light fell on her face
The sun shone on the fields
The light struck the golden necklace
A strange sound struck my ears

definitions.text: be captured
examples: The cities fell to the enemy

definitions.text: occur at a specified time or place
examples: Christmas falls on a Monday this year
The accent falls on the first syllable

definitions.text: decrease in size, extent, or range
examples: The amount of homework decreased towards the end of the semester
The cabin pressure fell dramatically
her weight fell to under a hundred pounds
his voice fell to a whisper

definitions.text: yield to temptation or sin
examples: Adam and Eve fell

definitions.text: lose office or power
examples: The government fell overnight
The Qing Dynasty fell with Sun Yat-sen

definitions.text: to be given by assignment or distribution
examples: The most difficult task fell on the youngest member of the team
The onus fell on us
The pressure to succeed fell on the youngest student

definitions.text: move in a specified direction
examples: The line of men fall forward

definitions.text: be due
examples: payments fall on the 1st of the month

definitions.text: lose one's chastity
examples: a fallen woman

definitions.text: to be given by right or inheritance
examples: The estate fell to the oldest daughter

definitions.text: come into the possession of
examples: The house accrued to the oldest son

definitions.text: fall to somebody by assignment or lot
examples: The task fell to me
It fell to me to notify the parents of the victims

definitions.text: be inherited by
examples: The estate fell to my sister
The land returned to the family
The estate devolved to an heir that everybody had assumed to be dead

definitions.text: slope downward
examples: The hills around here fall towards the ocean

definitions.text: lose an upright position suddenly
examples: The vase fell over and the water spilled onto the table
Her hair fell across her forehead

definitions.text: drop oneself to a lower or less erect position
examples: She fell back in her chair
He fell to his knees

definitions.text: fall or flow in a certain way
examples: This dress hangs well
Her long black hair flowed down her back

definitions.text: assume a disappointed or sad expression
examples: Her face fell when she heard that she would be laid off
his crest fell

definitions.text: be cast down
examples: his eyes fell

definitions.text: come out; issue
examples: silly phrases fell from her mouth

definitions.text: be born, used chiefly of lambs
examples: The lambs fell in the afternoon

definitions.text: begin vigorously
examples: The prisoners fell to work right away

definitions.text: go as if by falling
examples: Grief fell from our hearts

definitions.text: come as if by falling
examples: Night fell
Silence fell
